risk_areas.skill: online experimentation & causal inference at scale

staffing_recommendation.experiment_name: Query-Dependent Ranking Boost via Causal Uplift Modeling
staffing_recommendation.experiment_description: Introduce a lightweight, real-time uplift model that estimates the causal impact of boosting newly-launched verticals (jobs, events, local) on long-term query success metrics (CTR, SAT, repeat searches). The model will be trained on 60 days of logged bandit data, adjusted with inverse-propensity scoring, and rolled out as an A/B experiment on 5% of search traffic. Goal: +2% SAT with no regression in core web results.
rationale: Alice owns both large-scale ML ranking expertise and deep experience in online experimentation & causal inference, making her the ideal technical lead to design the uplift model and analyze the experiment.
Bob brings complementary large-scale ML engineering skills to implement the feature pipeline and model serving path; pairing him with Alice provides on-the-job mentoring in causal methods.
risks: No team member besides Alice has strong causal inference background—if she is unavailable, the experiment timeline slips significantly.
